snippet: One week before the national election, Angela Merkel’s conservative allies won a majority in the state vote, but her liberal partners in the government had a disastrous showing.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservative allies win a majority in state of Bavaria's elections for the regional Parliament, but her liberal partners in the national government fail miserably in federal elections; results make it less likely that Merkel will be able to form another coalition government with her liberal partners.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY and ALISON SMALE

lead_paragraph: One week before the national election, Angela Merkel’s conservative allies won a majority in the state vote, but her liberal partners in the government had a disastrous showing.

headline.main: Bavarian Voting Gives German Chancellor’s Re-election Hopes a Mixed Blessing
headline.print_headline: Bavarian Voting Gives German Chancellor’s Re-election Hopes a Mixed Blessing
